channel.title: The D3bug Blog
channel.description: Recent content on The D3bug Blog

item.title: Active Directory Lab
item.description:
Active Directory

Wikipedia

Active Directory (AD) is a directory service developed by Microsoft for Windows domain networks. Windows Server operating systems include it as a set of processes and services.[1][2] Originally, only centralized domain management used Active Directory. However, it ultimately became an umbrella title for various directory-based identity-related services.[3]

ChatGPT

Active Directory (AD) is a centralized directory and identity management system used in Windows-based networks. It allows organizations to manage users, computers, permissions, and security policies from one place.

item.title: About Me
item.description:
Hello. I’m Nick.

I’m a recent graduate who is interested in cybersecurity and the business world. I have a background in computer science and an MBA.

This blog is a place for me to write things out as I’m learning. Some posts are technical notes on on topics like networking, Active Directory, or security fundamentals. Others might be walkthroughs on LeetCode or Hack The Box challenges. Some might be summaries or thoughts on articles or books.
